intro: Phyllanthus emirnensis, commonly known as the Emirnensis spurge, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers, typical of the genus Phyllanthus. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. This plant is often found in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
